channel.title: Posts on Josh Wood
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Josh Wood

item.title: Migration brief
item.author: j@joshix.com (Josh Wood)
item.description:
The “jxnu” project put the site’s old content atop new infrastructure. This is a mostly-migrated version of the once and future joshix.com:

  • Built with Hugo,
  • served by the Caddy web server with automatic Let’s Encrypt TLS and HTTP/2,
  • packaged in a discrete App Container Image (ACI) based on caddybox,
  • executed by the rkt container engine,
  • running on CoreOS Linux.

item.title: At the oyster cellar
item.author: j@joshix.com (Josh Wood)
item.description:
S: What are the oysters tonight?
T: We have lots of oysters.
Pause.
S: Lots of kinds of oysters, or just very many oysters?
T: (uncertainly) Lots of kinds.
Pause.
S: OK. So… I’ll just name all the kinds of oysters I know, and when I hit on one you have, you tap your foot twice.
T: I’d need to go get a list.
S: Probably.

item.title: One reader writes:
item.author: j@joshix.com (Josh Wood)
item.description: Merger merger Android startup stock option implementation deadline! Professionalize Twitter social patent network effect artificial Linux scarcity! Freedom source monetize Bitcoin buyout Microsoft strategy! Mobile ubiquitous real-time synergy! Venture cap software stack core competency.

item.title: From the desert
item.author: j@joshix.com (Josh Wood)
item.description: I bought some cigarettes with a coupon. I’ve only done this once or twice before because buying your addictive drugs with a coupon seems less than shabby and none of my other dealers even take them, but Mr. R.J. Reynolds mails them to me. Direct. Because they’re mailed to me, the coupons have my name printed on the back. The cashier, who I call Quetzalcoatl, read my name on the coupon.

item.title: YATC, mb(1) "microbe" updated
item.author: j@joshix.com (Josh Wood)
item.description: I updated the simple Plan 9 microblogging scripts, mb(1), not often but sometimes also called “microbe”, and almost never known as “meekroh-bee”. All file and environment variable names have changed since the last release (c.2009, AD), replacing the “special” character micro (HTML’s &micro;, µ, µ) with a plain m. The awk | sed filter pipeline at the center of any useful improvement was taken from Stanley Lieber’s tw Twitter script.

item.title: Ferry stern, Aegean
item.author: j@joshix.com (Josh Wood)
item.description: Last leg of homeward odyssey on the Blue Star ferry Ithaki from Πειραιάς to Πάρος

item.title: Courtyard
item.author: j@joshix.com (Josh Wood)
item.description:
Paros. October 2006.

I stood on the rail and looked over the stone wall of the courtyard
Through the crosshairs of the crucifix atop the blue dome of the church
I saw people moving in the house-lights on the hillside
They seemed like signals

item.title: Roy Orbison
item.author: j@joshix.com (Josh Wood)
item.description:
pretty woman, give your smile to me
that is an imperative
I want to try it on
and I promise
not to wipe it off
with my greaserag this time
that last incident having been merely
a confusion of identity of me
for my brother who is not me
but is often mistaken for me

he’s the one who can play guitar

item.title: An advantage of angles
item.author: j@joshix.com (Josh Wood)
item.description:
Kansas City/Paros. November 2005.

Not every night is different
most begin with much the same choreography
a geometry of sky folding closed and Sound
thrown out of a day’s dance with the wind
when Silence cuts in.

Stars pick out jasmine’s shadow negative against
their black matting, their paper backing, where

item.title: Inked (Don’t You Call Me (two (too) Haikus))
item.author: j@joshix.com (Josh Wood)
item.description:
Kansas City. November 2005.

triple ribbon is
efficient because it
abandoned hue
